In 2004, just after revelations about the abuse of Iraqi prisoners at Abu Ghraib, Donald Rumsfeld writes that former Bill Clinton approached him and said: No one with an ounce of sense thinks you had any way in the world to know about the abuse taking place that night in Iraq. Donald Rumsfeld also recounts details of his career in government and politics well before he became the controversial Pentagon chief. He delves into his decades-old rivalry with former George H.W.
